page.title: 12INTERVIEW-a working farmer
page.content: A tenant farmer in his middle 30's with a wife and 2 children has lived here all his life.As a boy he recalls 5 working farms in and around his village now his is the only one.He remembers a social life centred on the village hall and the church,a village alive with children.Now he feels his children are more isolated within their 'community' and far more dependent on their parents for transport and entertainment. He considers the polarization of the population to be the greatest change to have taken place.When a boy the villagers were nearly all working on the land.With a reduction of farm units,an increase in unit size and mechanisation man-power requirements have reduced.Thus vacant farm housing has found a new market in retired and better-off people.
